intro: Phymatopsis triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Phymatopsis triloba is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
